prompt:
Create 4 prompts for a cohesive, chronologically flowing thank-you greeting card that tells a visual story (9:16 ratio):

üé® CREATIVITY MANDATE: Be genuinely creative, unique, and innovative! Avoid generic or clich√© designs. Think outside the box, surprise with unexpected elements, use bold artistic choices, and create something truly memorable and special. Push creative boundaries while staying appropriate for the card type and tone.

Theme: "Thank you for attending, thank you for helping prosper thought. include a nice quote in left interior. front Cover:  include John Gilbert clearly and mention ‚ÄúAI For Good Conference Stanford CA June 2025‚Äù. make the artwork in general beautiful, charming, but also appropriately professional. Include a nice tree in front cover on stanford campus and include cute cartoon green dinosaur holding a greeting card with a heart. don‚Äôt draw any people. use light color theme. make sure any text is not close to borders"
Style: ‚ú® Smart Style
Tone: üåü Inspirational - motivating and uplifting
To: John Gilbert
From: Vibecarding.com Team
Message: "John,

Thank you for being a part of AI for Good this year. Your presence and insightful contributions truly helped to elevate the conversation and inspire new ways of thinking. We are so grateful for minds like yours that are actively shaping a brighter, more thoughtful future for everyone.

With sincere appreciation,
The Vibecarding.com Team"



CRITICAL: Create a cohesive visual narrative that flows chronologically through the card experience:
1. FRONT COVER: First impression - sets the scene/introduces the story
2. INTERIOR SPREAD: The heart of the experience - continuation and climax of the visual story
3. BACK COVER: Conclusion - peaceful resolution or complementary ending

Requirements:
- Flat 2D artwork for printing (not 3D card images)
- Full-bleed backgrounds extending to edges
- IMPORTANT: Keep text, faces, and key elements at least 10% away from top/bottom edges (small amount may be cropped in printing)
- Keep text/faces 0.5" from left/right edges for safe printing
- CONSISTENT visual elements throughout: same characters, color palette, lighting, art style
- Progressive visual storytelling from front ‚Üí interior ‚Üí back
- Put any text in quotes and make it clear/readable
- Each section should feel like part of the same artistic universe
- TONE: Ensure the visual mood and atmosphere matches the motivating and uplifting tone throughout all sections
- INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY SAFETY: If the user mentions specific characters, brands, logos, or products, automatically replace them with original generic alternatives in your prompts. For example: replace specific character names with "cartoon mouse character" or "superhero character", replace brand names with "colorful cereal" or "sports car", etc. Create inspired-by designs that capture the essence without referencing any protected names or specific copyrighted elements. Never include actual brand names, character names, or trademarked terms in the image generation prompts
- CONTENT SAFETY: Ensure all prompts are family-friendly and appropriate for greeting cards. Avoid any content that could be flagged by safety systems including: violence, weapons, inappropriate imagery, political content, controversial topics, scary or disturbing elements, or anything not suitable for all ages. If the user requests something potentially inappropriate, redirect to positive, wholesome alternatives that capture their intent in a family-friendly way








Create prompts that flow chronologically:

1. Front Cover (Opening Scene): BE GENUINELY CREATIVE AND UNIQUE! Include "thank-you" greeting text positioned safely in the center area (avoid top/bottom 10% of image). TEXT STYLE: Write the greeting text in beautiful, clearly readable handwritten cursive script that matches the elegant style used inside the card - legible, flowing, and graceful with natural character and warmth. Create charming cartoon-style or stylized illustrated figures if people are needed for the theme. This is the story opening - introduce key visual elements (colors, motifs, artistic style) that will continue throughout the other sections. Think of something unexpected, innovative, and memorable that will surprise and delight the recipient. Avoid generic designs! Style: in a gentle, luminous watercolor style. The scene is bathed in the soft, warm light of a California morning, rendered with a light and airy touch. The color palette consists of pale greens, soft sky blues, creamy whites, and touches of sunny yellow, creating a peaceful and uplifting atmosphere. The artwork features visible, yet delicate, brushstrokes and soft, bleeding edges where colors meet, giving it a handcrafted, organic feel. A beautifully rendered, recognizable Stanford campus tree stands gracefully, its leaves a dappling of light greens and yellows. Nestled near its base is a charmingly illustrated, cartoon green dinosaur, drawn with simple, friendly lines and a sweet smile. The dinosaur holds a tiny greeting card with a single, hand-painted red heart, adding a touch of personal warmth and whimsy. All text is rendered in an elegant, flowing, hand-lettered font that feels personal and artistic, placed carefully away from the borders to maintain a sense of open, uncluttered beauty.

2. Left Interior (Story Development): UNLEASH YOUR CREATIVITY! You have complete creative freedom to design whatever you want for this left interior page! This is your artistic playground - create something genuinely innovative and unexpected that feels right for a thank-you card with motivating and uplifting tone. You can include: scenes, landscapes, objects, patterns, quotes, text, illustrations, realistic art, abstract art, or anything else that inspires you - but NO PEOPLE or characters unless the user specifically mentioned wanting people in their card description. Position any text safely in center area (avoid top/bottom 10%). Think of something no one has done before! Surprise us with bold, imaginative, and memorable artistic choices while maintaining visual harmony with the overall card style and tone. Style: in a gentle, luminous watercolor style. The scene is bathed in the soft, warm light of a California morning, rendered with a light and airy touch. The color palette consists of pale greens, soft sky blues, creamy whites, and touches of sunny yellow, creating a peaceful and uplifting atmosphere. The artwork features visible, yet delicate, brushstrokes and soft, bleeding edges where colors meet, giving it a handcrafted, organic feel. A beautifully rendered, recognizable Stanford campus tree stands gracefully, its leaves a dappling of light greens and yellows. Nestled near its base is a charmingly illustrated, cartoon green dinosaur, drawn with simple, friendly lines and a sweet smile. The dinosaur holds a tiny greeting card with a single, hand-painted red heart, adding a touch of personal warmth and whimsy. All text is rendered in an elegant, flowing, hand-lettered font that feels personal and artistic, placed carefully away from the borders to maintain a sense of open, uncluttered beauty.

3. Right Interior (Story Climax): BE CREATIVE WITH MESSAGE DESIGN! Include message text: "John,

Thank you for being a part of AI for Good this year. Your presence and insightful contributions truly helped to elevate the conversation and inspire new ways of thinking. We are so grateful for minds like yours that are actively shaping a brighter, more thoughtful future for everyone.

With sincere appreciation,
The Vibecarding.com Team" positioned safely in center area (avoid top/bottom 10% of image) integrated into beautiful, innovative decorative artwork. HANDWRITING STYLE: Write the message in beautiful, clearly readable handwritten cursive script that feels elegant and personal. The handwriting should be legible, flowing, and have natural character - not overly perfect but graceful and warm. Use a nice pen-style appearance with natural ink flow and slight variations in line weight. Think of sophisticated calligraphy that's still approachable and easy to read. Make the handwriting feel genuine and heartfelt. Think beyond typical florals and patterns - create something unexpected and artistic that perfectly frames the handwritten message - NO PEOPLE or characters. This should feel like the emotional peak of the card experience, harmonizing with the left interior as a cohesive spread. Avoid clich√© designs and create something genuinely special! Use the elegant cursive handwriting style described above. Style: in a gentle, luminous watercolor style. The scene is bathed in the soft, warm light of a California morning, rendered with a light and airy touch. The color palette consists of pale greens, soft sky blues, creamy whites, and touches of sunny yellow, creating a peaceful and uplifting atmosphere. The artwork features visible, yet delicate, brushstrokes and soft, bleeding edges where colors meet, giving it a handcrafted, organic feel. A beautifully rendered, recognizable Stanford campus tree stands gracefully, its leaves a dappling of light greens and yellows. Nestled near its base is a charmingly illustrated, cartoon green dinosaur, drawn with simple, friendly lines and a sweet smile. The dinosaur holds a tiny greeting card with a single, hand-painted red heart, adding a touch of personal warmth and whimsy. All text is rendered in an elegant, flowing, hand-lettered font that feels personal and artistic, placed carefully away from the borders to maintain a sense of open, uncluttered beauty.

4. Back Cover (Story Resolution): BE SUBTLY CREATIVE! Create a simple yet innovative decorative design that brings peaceful closure to the visual story. Reference subtle elements from the front cover but keep it minimal and serene - NO PEOPLE, just beautiful, unexpected artistic elements that go beyond typical patterns or florals. IMPORTANT: Leave the bottom-right corner area (approximately 1 inch square) completely clear and undecorated - this space is reserved for a QR code. Focus decorative elements toward the center and left side of the design. Think of something quietly beautiful and memorable that complements the overall design while being genuinely unique. This should feel like a peaceful, artistic ending that surprises with its subtle creativity. Style: in a gentle, luminous watercolor style. The scene is bathed in the soft, warm light of a California morning, rendered with a light and airy touch. The color palette consists of pale greens, soft sky blues, creamy whites, and touches of sunny yellow, creating a peaceful and uplifting atmosphere. The artwork features visible, yet delicate, brushstrokes and soft, bleeding edges where colors meet, giving it a handcrafted, organic feel. A beautifully rendered, recognizable Stanford campus tree stands gracefully, its leaves a dappling of light greens and yellows. Nestled near its base is a charmingly illustrated, cartoon green dinosaur, drawn with simple, friendly lines and a sweet smile. The dinosaur holds a tiny greeting card with a single, hand-painted red heart, adding a touch of personal warmth and whimsy. All text is rendered in an elegant, flowing, hand-lettered font that feels personal and artistic, placed carefully away from the borders to maintain a sense of open, uncluttered beauty.

VISUAL CONTINUITY CHECKLIST:
- Same color palette across all sections
- Consistent lighting/time of day
- Same artistic techniques and brushwork
- Recurring visual motifs or symbols (but make them unique and memorable!)
- Progressive emotional journey from introduction to resolution
- Front cover: stylized cartoon/illustrated characters if people are needed for the theme
- Left interior: CREATIVE FREEDOM but NO PEOPLE unless user specifically requested people in their description
- Right interior: focus on message space with innovative decorative elements (NO PEOPLE)
- Back cover: simple yet creative decorative design without text or people
- Use simplified, friendly, charming character design if including people (front cover only)
- CREATIVITY PRIORITY: Always choose the more innovative, surprising, and memorable option over generic designs

Return JSON:
{
  "frontCover": "detailed prompt with story opening elements",
  "backCover": "detailed prompt with story conclusion elements",
  "leftInterior": "detailed prompt with story development elements",
  "rightInterior": "detailed prompt with story climax elements"
}

IMPORTANT: Create a completely unique and different interpretation for this specific card variant. Use different creative approaches, color schemes, compositions, and artistic elements while maintaining the same core theme and requirements.

generatedPrompts.backCover: Back cover design for a greeting card with a gentle, luminous watercolor style. The scene is bathed in soft, warm light, rendered with a light and airy touch. The color palette consists of pale greens, soft sky blues, and creamy whites, creating a peaceful and uplifting atmosphere. The artwork features delicate brushstrokes and soft, bleeding edges where colors meet. The design is minimal and serene, focusing on subtle artistic elements that provide closure to the visual story. In the lower left quadrant, a portion of a charmingly illustrated, cartoon green dinosaur is visible, with simple, friendly lines and a sweet smile, suggesting its presence from the front cover. Floating in the upper left area is a single, pale yellow leaf, echoing a motif from the front cover. The majority of the background is a soft, white space, with subtle washes of pale green and blue watercolor clouds. The bottom-right corner is completely clear and undecorated, reserved for a QR code. The overall composition is simple, subtly creative, and complements the card's theme with a sense of quiet beauty.
generatedPrompts.leftInterior: Left interior page of a greeting card with a soft watercolor background in a 9:16 aspect ratio. The background features a gentle wash of pale blue in the upper and lower portions, transitioning into a soft, cloud-like shape of layered pale yellow and light green hues towards the center and right side. The colors bleed into each other with delicate, visible watercolor brushstrokes, creating a luminous and ethereal effect. Prominently displayed in a beautiful, flowing, and legible cursive script, in a muted green ink, is the quote: "The mind that opens to a new idea never returns to its original size." The text is artfully arranged within the yellow and green cloud formation, appearing organic and integrated with the artwork. The overall aesthetic is charming, inspirational, and intellectually stimulating, with a light and airy feel, characteristic of a smart, uplifting style.
generatedPrompts.rightInterior: Right interior page of a greeting card designed for message space with elegant, flowing watercolor botanical elements framing the text. The artistic style is a gentle, luminous watercolor with soft, bleeding edges. The color palette is dominated by pale greens and soft yellows for the leaves and stems, against a very light, hazy blue or green background. The botanical elements, specifically delicate leafy vines, are positioned vertically along the left and right edges of the interior spread, creating a natural, organic border. These vines are rendered with visible, yet delicate, brushstrokes, giving them a handcrafted feel. The space within these borders is primarily open, allowing ample room for a handwritten message. The message itself is presented in a sophisticated, legible, and flowing cursive script, rendered in a dark grey or charcoal ink, mimicking the appearance of natural ink flow with slight variations in line weight, providing a personal and warm touch. The overall impression is one of understated elegance, warmth, and natural beauty, with the decorative elements subtly enhancing the message without overwhelming it. There are no printed text elements other than the message itself. The design avoids any borders or frames that are too rigid, opting instead for the organic flow of the watercolor botanicals. The composition is balanced, with the greenery drawing the eye inwards towards the central message space.
